results.deck: An MMORPG set in the world of Nirn, focusing on the familiar continent of Tamriel, taking place a thousand years before The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim.
results.name: The Elder Scrolls Online

results.deck: A first-person interactive experience revolving around exploration and discovery in a residential locale.
results.name: Gone Home

results.deck: Rising to prominence through the American fighting game community, Divekick is an indie fighting game that distills the controls into two simple buttons, requiring  clever strategy as players try to score the first hit with their divekick attack!
results.name: Divekick

results.deck: Divinity: Original Sin is a top-down turn-based RPG developed by Larian Studios. It introduces new elements to the franchise, such as co-op gameplay and decision-making as well as a more interactive world.
results.name: Divinity: Original Sin

results.deck: A first-person horror game played from the perspective of a two-year-old child. Players will confront creatures and environments that straddle the line between real and surreal.
results.name: Among The Sleep

results.deck: The DC Universe's most powerful heroes and villains collide in this 2.5D fighting game from the creators of the Mortal Kombat series.
results.name: Injustice: Gods Among Us

results.deck: Defend your pre-built castle while laying siege on your opponent's using a variety of different units (including your hero, your ballista, and some troops) and powerful spells in this side-scrolling action real-time strategy game.
results.name: CastleStorm

results.deck: Human Element is the first game from Robotoki. It is about zombies and survival. The game is on hiatus as of January 20, 2015.
results.name: Human Element

results.deck: A third-person open-world game from Ubisoft, set in a dark alternate version of the US where corporations track and catalog all online behavior over a vast data network. A vigilante group called the Watch_Dogs hacks into this data, using it to hunt criminals.
results.name: Watch Dogs

results.deck: The fourth game by Quantic Dream. It tells the story of Jodie Holmes, a girl with mysterious powers who is on the run from the law.
results.name: Beyond: Two Souls

results.deck: With the help from the CRIMENET underground criminal network, the Payday crew don their masks once again for a new epic crime spree in Washington, D.C.
results.name: Payday 2

results.deck: A microbe-themed puzzle game by Cipher Prime
results.name: Splice

results.deck: A mission based side-scrolling 2D shooter with loot and craftable weapons.
results.name: Mercenary Kings

results.deck: HOKRA is an independently developed "Sports" video game by Ramiro Corbetta.
results.name: HOKRA

results.deck: A metroidvania style action adventure.
results.name: The Iconoclasts

results.deck: Despite the misleading title, this is actually an on-disc collection of the previously PSN-exclusive titles flOw, Flower, and Journey.
results.name: Journey Collector's Edition

results.deck: A free-to-play, third-person action shooter developed by Digital Extremes.
results.name: Warframe

results.deck: An indie minimalist puzzle platformer.
results.name: Thomas Was Alone

results.deck: Home is an indie horror game developed by Benjamin Rivers.
results.name: Home

results.deck: Telltale's continuation of the Back to the Future story.  It contains 5 episodes.
results.name: Back to the Future: The Game

results.deck: A rhythm game - fighting game hybrid for PlayStation 3, Vita, and PC
results.name: KickBeat

results.deck: War Thunder is a free-to-play air combat game set in the World War II and Korean War eras. Naval and land battles are planned additions.
results.name: War Thunder

results.deck: Sequel to the first Defense Grid game, released following a successful Kickstarter campaign.
results.name: Defense Grid 2

results.deck: Break the fourth wall in this 3rd person action game, the first headlined by "The Merc With A Mouth" Deadpool.
results.name: Deadpool

results.deck: Reconsider the laws of physics in this 2D puzzle game.
results.name: The Bridge

results.deck: DICE's popular multiplayer-focused shooter series continues, making its debut appearance on the PS4 and Xbox One.
results.name: Battlefield 4

results.deck: After separating from her friend Lee, young orphan Clementine must survive through the undead apocalypse with a new roaming group of survivors in this sequel to Telltale's original five-part adventure based on the comic book The Walking Dead.
results.name: The Walking Dead: Season Two

results.deck: The fourth main entry in the Samurai Warriors series. It was released in 2014 to coincide with the tenth anniversary of the franchise.
results.name: Samurai Warriors 4

results.deck: Unmechanical is a puzzle game that started off as a student project.
results.name: Unmechanical

results.deck: A true sequel and new installment in the BlazBlue franchise, taking place after the events of Continuum Shift.
results.name: BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma

results.deck: Beginning as a mod for ArmA II, the online zombie survival shooter DayZ is now a standalone game. It is currently in alpha, but is available as an Early Access game on Steam.
results.name: DayZ

results.deck: British studio Mediatonic's side scrolling theatre based brawler, making the emphasis on performance and entertaining the audience over survival.
results.name: Foul Play

results.deck: In this PlayStation 4 horror game, eight teenagers are being hunted while they stay at a mountain retreat.
results.name: Until Dawn

results.deck: A top-down action combat game with an 80s aesthetic, a brutal style, and a thoughtful, slightly surreal philosophy underlying the story about the nature of violence.
results.name: Hotline Miami

results.deck: Bowling game released for PSN. It features an anime art style along with wacky bear shenanigans.
results.name: Crazy Strike Bowling

results.deck: While the original Dragon Fantasy was an homage to NES-era RPGs, Book II moves up to the 16-bit SNES era.
results.name: Dragon Fantasy: Book II

results.deck: The third entry in the Super Mario Bros inspired platformer series.
results.name: Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams

results.deck: George and Nico return for the fifth game in Charles Cecil's Broken Sword franchise. They embark on an all new adventure that involves an investigation into an armed raid on a Paris gallery. Partially funded by Kickstarter.
results.name: Broken Sword: The Serpent's Curse

results.deck: The stand-alone prelude to Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain, giving players a taste of the new open-world gameplay mechanics while setting up the main game's story, as Snake (Big Boss) must infiltrate a prison camp to rescue his comrades.
results.name: Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes

results.deck: From the developer of SpaceChem, Ironclad Tactics is a realtime tactical card game set in an alternate-historical version of the American Civil War in which steam-powered robots rule the battlefield.
results.name: Ironclad Tactics

results.deck: Knock-Knock is a Kickstarter-funded adventure game by Russian developer Ice-Pick Lodge.
results.name: Knock-Knock

results.deck: 1001 Spikes is a "masocore" platformer where the player is given 1001 lives to complete the game.
results.name: 1001 Spikes

results.deck: A roguelike exploration/survival game from the creators of Shank and Mark of the Ninja.
results.name: Don't Starve

results.deck: While investigating a mass murder, Detective Sebastian Castellanos descends into a gruesome, nightmarish world. This third-person survival horror game marks the debut of Tango Gameworks, a studio headed by Resident Evil progenitor Shinji Mikami.
results.name: The Evil Within

results.deck: Wii U eShop launch game from Shinen, a sequel to the 3DS game Nano Asssault.
results.name: Nano Assault Neo

results.deck: A retro style shooter with a frantic and colorful aesthetic. It is comprised of extremely short mini-stages, in the vein of Wario Ware.
results.name: Death Ray Manta

results.deck: Armello is a multiplayer card and board game set in a fairy-tale animal kingdom. It is the debut title from League of Geeks.
results.name: Armello

results.deck: Slender: The Arrival is a horror adventure game. It is the first official sequel to Slender: The Eight Pages.
results.name: Slender: The Arrival

results.deck: Two brothers are on a search for a cure for their dying father.
results.name: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons

results.deck: Protect kitten miners and their undersea milk drilling operation in this Defender-like shooter.
results.name: Aqua Kitty: Milk Mine Defender

results.deck: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee New 'n' Tasty is a remake of the original Oddworld game, Abe's Oddysee.
results.name: Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee New 'n' Tasty!

results.deck: The popular science fiction film franchise crosses over into Angry Birds territory.
results.name: Angry Birds: Star Wars

results.deck: A sequel to the original Ninja-Kid (Ninja-kun), Ninja-Kid II is a side-scrolling platformer action game for Arcades. It is also known as Rad Action and JT-104, and was later ported to the NES in Japan only.
results.name: Ninja-Kid II

results.deck: 2 Fast 4 Gnomz is an auto running game for the Wii and 3DS download services.
results.name: 2 Fast 4 Gnomz

results.deck: Deep within the abandoned halls of Mount Massive Asylum, amateur journalist Miles Upshur sets out to find a good story, and instead finds an evil presence.
results.name: Outlast

results.deck: A ZX Spectrum styled game that is set on Mars in the 1880s.
results.name: Rock Boshers DX

results.deck: The eighth entry in the Dynasty Warriors franchise, released in western markets in July of 2013.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors 8

results.deck: A multiplayer, PVP focused follow-up to Muse Games' Guns of Icarus.
results.name: Guns of Icarus Online

results.deck: Nom Nom Galaxy is an sandbox platformer with tower-defense and RTS mechanics.
results.name: Nom Nom Galaxy

results.deck: High-definition remake of the 2010 Genesis RPG.
results.name: Pier Solar and the Great Architects

results.deck: Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds is a beat-em-up that was released on XBLA, and is slated for release on the PlayStation Vita and PlayStation 4. It is a spinoff of 5pb's 2D fighting game.
results.name: Phantom Breaker: Battle Grounds

results.deck: The third entry in WayForward's Shantae series, and the first to see a release on home consoles. Shantae is forced to work with her archenemy Risky Boots to stop an even more evil pirate.
results.name: Shantae and the Pirate's Curse

results.deck: A 2D sports game part of the Sportsfriends collection where 2-4 players compete to try to drop the ball into the water on one side in an arena format similar to Super Smash Bros.
results.name: BaraBariBall

results.deck: Stealth Bastard Deluxe is an updated version of the original freeware stealth platformer.
results.name: Stealth Bastard Deluxe

results.deck: A Bullet Hell Shoot 'Em Up released by the Japanese indie developer Edelweiss.
results.name: Astebreed

results.deck: A puzzle/strategy game where players control a squad of zombies.
results.name: Ray's the Dead

results.deck: Distance is a survival racing game that is the spiritual successor to Nitronic Rush. Players control a unique car that can boost, jump, rotate, and even fly.
results.name: Distance

results.deck: The fifth entry in the Metal Gear Solid series recounts the adventures of Punished 'Venom' Snake, as he wakes up from a nine-year coma in 1984 to rebuild his mercenary paradise.
results.name: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

results.deck: Blood, souls, and tears are continually spent as players traverse the land of Drangleic in FromSoftware's third entry in the Souls series.
results.name: Dark Souls II

results.deck: This enhanced remake of the original Binding of Isaac features expanded gameplay, pixel art visuals, and a variety of other new additions - including full controller support and local asymmetric co-op.
results.name: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth

results.deck: The sequel to Dennaton's hit 2D action game moves the neon murder from the '80s to a '90s setting, and concludes the series.
results.name: Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number

results.deck: The denizens of the Marvel Universe battle it out LEGO style.
results.name: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes

results.deck: A 2-player co-op micro-platformer where the players must control a pink spaceship by interacting with systems inside of the ship.
results.name: Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime

results.deck: An action platformer for the Arcades produced by UPL. It was later ported to the Famicom by Jaleco. It's known as Ninja-kun in Japan, and is the first of the Ninja-kun series.
results.name: Ninja-Kid

results.deck: Xing is an upcoming first-person adventure game. As you explore the land's of Xing you must solve a diversity of puzzles while earning new abilities involving the manipulation of space and time.
results.name: Xing

results.deck: Teslagrad is a 2D puzzle-platformer where both your creativity and logic will be put to the test as you navigate treacherous levels armed with the power of magnetism.
results.name: Teslagrad

results.deck: Evolve is a class-based cooperative-competitive game in which a team of four hunters chase after an evolving monster, also controlled by a player.
results.name: Evolve

results.deck: Saturday Morning RPG is an episodic role-playing game based in a world of Saturday morning cartoons.
results.name: Saturday Morning RPG

results.deck: A parody of the popular "Simulator" series of games depicting realistic takes on generally boring careers, Surgeon Simulator 2013 is a wildly unrealistic depiction of kidney, heart, and brain surgery where the primary challenge comes from the game's deliberately awkward controls.
results.name: Surgeon Simulator 2013

results.deck: Celebrating 25 years of John Madden Football. No correlation to the year 2025.
results.name: Madden NFL 25

results.deck: CD Projekt RED's third Witcher combines the series' non-linear storytelling with a sprawling open world that concludes the saga of Geralt of Rivia.
results.name: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

results.deck: Yank the top half of a Skylanders toy off of its base and connect it to a different bottom half to make new combinations in the third Skylanders game.
results.name: Skylanders SWAP Force

results.deck: An adventure game from The Astronauts – a development team comprised of People Can Fly veterans.
results.name: The Vanishing of Ethan Carter

results.deck: Action Tower Defense game where you collect strawberries and zap monsters
results.name: McDroid

results.deck: The sixth main installment of the Assassin's Creed franchise, set in the Caribbean during the age of piracy in the early 18th century. Players explore the memories of Edward Kenway, a charismatic pirate (turned reckless Assassin) and the grandfather of Connor Kenway, the protagonist of Assassin's Creed III.
results.name: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag

results.deck: The tenth installment of the long-running shooter franchise introduces a brand new storyline, where the United States is under threat from a coalition of South American nations, and must employ a special group of operatives known as "Ghosts" to survive.
results.name: Call of Duty: Ghosts

results.deck: A supernatural mystery game in which Ronan O’Connor, deceased detective, tries to solve his own murder.
results.name: Murdered: Soul Suspect

results.deck: Daylight is a survival horror game powered by Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4.
results.name: Daylight

results.deck: Super Ubie Land is a 2D platformer inspired by Super Mario World, Donkey Kong Country and Kirby's Dreamland.
results.name: Super Ubie Island

results.deck: A weird little platforming-shooter exclusively for the Wii U eShop. The player is the Buddy on Rails who has to save Scram Kitty and all cats from space-rats. Scram Kitty gives advice on the TV while the Buddy on Rails does crazy shooting on the GamePad screen.
results.name: Scram Kitty and his Buddy on Rails

results.deck: A rhythm-based platformer made in the spare time of the lead gameplay designer at Playdead.
A first-person adventure about restoring memories.
results.name: Ether One

results.deck: There Came an Echo is a squad-based strategy game that relies heavily on voice commands. It was developed by Iridium Studios.
results.name: There Came an Echo

results.deck: An action-platformer from Mark Cerny and SCE Japan Studio for PlayStation 4. Knack was the first game ever shown on PS4.
results.name: Knack

results.deck: Killzone comes to PlayStation 4.
results.name: Killzone: Shadow Fall

results.deck: Driveclub is a team-based racing game from Evolution Studios for PlayStation 4.
results.name: Driveclub

results.deck: Set seven years after the events of inFamous 2, Second Son stars a new protagonist, Delsin Rowe, who fights back against government oppression and must face off with his own brother in the process. It takes place in the city of Seattle, Washington, the first real location used in the series.
results.name: inFamous: Second Son

results.deck: A medieval fantasy game for PlayStation 4 from Capcom, using the new Panta Rhei engine.
results.name: Deep Down

results.deck: A follow-up to SRPG Rainbow Moon, Skies introduces a new world and cast of characters.
results.name: Rainbow Skies

results.deck: Action puzzle game where the player controls a mining machine on a procedurally-generated Mars.
results.name: Super Motherload
